dialogues.text: I bet you could score up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, man, check out the bikes, man.   Yamaha, Suzuki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Sukiyaki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willard moves on, Chef and Clean catch up with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This must be the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willard and the men approach a harried SERGEANT at a  requisition desk, filling out papers, answering questions shouting out orders to the frenetic activity around him. There are soldiers scurrying back and forth, loading and  unloading supplies.  They constantly interrupt the sergea with their questions. Chef and Clean stop in front of the sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Move!  We have one hour, that's  all! (to Clean) What do you want?

dialogues.text: Panama Red?  Yeah, I'll get you  Panama Red.

dialogues.text: Sergeant.

dialogues.text: Destination?

dialogues.text: I don't have a destination.

dialogues.text: You can't get a goddamn thing  without a destination.

dialogues.text: Listen, sir, it's a real big night- (to another soldier) Eight dollars for that camera-

dialogues.text: With unexpected rage, Willard suddenly reaches up and gra the Sergeant by the collar, pulling him down across a tab really frightening him.  Everybody is quite surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give them some fuel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willard lets go of the sergeant, almost embarrassed for  the show of temper.  The sergeant goes back behind his  desk and starts signing papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Captain...I'm really sorry  about tonight.  It's really bad  around here.  Just take this over  to the man at the supply desk and  you got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tears off a requisition and hands it to one of the tri

dialogues.text: (to crew) Listen, would you guys like some  press box seats for the show?  You  want those?  The show, man, out  here.  The bunnies.

dialogues.text: The Playboy bunnies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sergeant finally leaves the trio, grabs a bottle of  cognac, and moves to Willard.  Hands him the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, listen, Captain...on the house.   No hard feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willard looks down at the bottle in his hand and then up  at the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of ENGINES is heard.  A HUEY and TWO LOCHES  descend from the clouds.  The Loches hover and circle,  while the Huey descends onto the platform stage.  There i a large black-and-white PLAYBOY INSIGNIA painted on the  nose.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The entire area around the stage and right up to the barb wire is mobbed with hundreds of seething American men.   Some of these boys have just gotten here, others have bee in the jungle for months.  It's the Vietnam military vers of a happening.  Guys from all walks of life, from the  cities, guys with flowers in their hair and peace signs  around their necks, other guys with their short-time stic and war medallions around their necks.  Black G.I.s  congregate together with their clenched-fist black power  medallions.  There are signs and posters and graffiti  everywhere.  Some guys have guitars, everyone seems to  have a camera.  Rummaging, sitting, waiting expectantly,  before the enormous stage, which is protected by rings of concertina wire, a moat, and M.P.s every three feet at  riot control positions.  Many joints and pipes are being  passed around.  Snapshots are being taken.  It has a stro resemblance to a love-in or even Woodstock.  Except that  they're all in various degrees of combat fatigues, and  they're all men. CHEF, CLEAN, LANCE, WILLARD AND THE CHIEF move down an  aisle to their seats.  It is through WILLARD'S EYES that  we see this spectacle, bad every so often we will see an  enthusiastic Lance, Chef, and Clean.  The Chief remains  noncommittal, and somewhat bored.  To the others, it's a  wonder of wonders. Over by the dock, behind the chain-link fence, there is a group of VIETNAMESE who have gathered to watch the show. They have brought rice, food, etc. They will watch and  react throughout, along with the American soldiers who ar standing guard in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: VIEW ON THE STAGE
dialogues.text: The Playboy copter descends onto the stage.  The door of  the Huey slides open and TWO YOUNG GREEN BERETS step out  with their M16s to varied CATCALLS.  When this abates, a  young and extremely well-dressed man emerges.  He is the  epitome of the Hollywood agent.  He's informal, high-stru and good at what he does.  His presence causes some stirr and occasional shouts of "ripoff" from the men.  He gets microphone from the stage, then walks to the front and  addresses the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing out there? (beat and reaction) I said how you doing out there? (beat and reaction) Wanna say hello to you from all of  us up here, to all of you out there,  who work so goddamn hard on  Operation Brute Force.  Hello, all  you Paratroopers out there!  And  the Marines!  And the Sailors!  We  wanna let you know that we're proud  of you, 'cause we know how tough  and how hard it's been!  Yeah!   And to prove it, we're gonna give  you some entertainment we know  you're gonna like!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band starts its rock 'n' roll amp, playing the Creede Clearwater Revival rendition of "Suzy Q".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss August, Miss Sandra Beatty!   Miss Nay, Miss Terri Tersay!  And  the Playmate of the year, Miss  Carrie Foster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two very beautiful PLAYMATES in exotic, brief costumes  come out of the helicopter.  They are TERRI and SANDRA,  and they start swaying to the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two playmates jump down and dance to the front of the stage.  The G.I.s go crazy and the girls dance their erot dance.  In the meantime.  The two Green Berets at the  helicopter help out the PLAYMATE OF THE YEAR, CARRIE FOST The Berets carry the Playmate out on their rifles to the  center of the stage, and put here down.  She dances forwa and joins the other two girls and the front.  Carrie is  dressed in a Western outfit.  They all dance to "Suzy Q".

dialogues.speaker: VIEW OF THE CROWD
dialogues.text: Appropriately, they go wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, baby!  I'm here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Terri) You fucking bitch!

dialogues.speaker: THE AGENT
dialogues.text: Looking at little worried.

dialogues.speaker: WILLARD AND THE CHIEF
dialogues.text: watching the spectacle.  Willard takes a drink from the  bottle that was given to him by the supply sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three Playmates going through all their gyrations.

dialogues.speaker: WILLARD
dialogues.text: Reacting, shaking his head.  Chef, Lance, and Clean all  think it's fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: VIEW ON THE CROWD
dialogues.text: Audience continues to react as the three Playmates sway  and hump.  Fights are breaking out.  Some of the G.I.s  pull out centerfolds of the three girls from under their  uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign my centerfold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaps madly, climbing up on the stage.  Other guys sta to follow him.  The M.P.s try to stop them but to no avai Before you know it, a mba is storming the stage.

dialogues.speaker: VIEW ON AGENT
dialogues.text: Knows the show is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Pilot) Start her up. (to M.P.s) Get the girls!  Let's go! (to crowd) So long!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Playmates are helped back into the helicopter.  The  rotors whine and the Huey lifts off just as the first of  the enthusiast mob reaches it.  The agent sets off a smok bomb to disperse the crowd.  Some guys are even hanging  onto the skids of the helicopter.  They finally let go an fall into the water below, as the helicopter flies away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie didn't get much U.S.O. He  was dug in too deep or moving too  fast.  His idea of great R and R  was cold rice, and a little rat  meat.  He had only two ways home- death, or victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the PBR pulls away from the Hau Phat area, Willard loo back at the clean-up operations, a helicopter hovers over the littered area, shirtless men sweep and mop up the sta burn trash; others dismantle the floating lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder Kurtz put a weed up  Command's ass.  The war was being  run by a bunch of four-star clowns,  who were gonna end up giving the  whole circus away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief is steering the boat.  Chef is looking at a Playboy magazine centerfold of Terri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, man, that was far fucking  out.  I collected every picture of  her since she was Miss December. (showing Clean the  centerfold) Hey, Clean, look at that.  She was  here, man!  I even wrote to the  cunt.  She didn't write me back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can get really hung up on these  broads, like that cat in the delta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  What cat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Clean talks, Chef tears the centerfold out of his  Playboy, then kneels down by the bulkhead in back of the  wheel.  He tapes the centerfold onto the bulkhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one that went up for murder?   He was an army Sergeant.  This  cat, he really dug his Playboy,  man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he continues, Lance moves to the back of the boat and  starts unwrapping the plastic from his new water skis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, this cat, when the thing  arrived, he was there to meet it,  man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating photo) Look at these beautiful fucking  jugs, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, he was working ARVN patrols,  had one of them cocky gook asshole  lieutenants, and one day the gook  took his magazine and wouldn't  give it back!  Cat said "Gimme my  magazine back!"  Good said, "You  shut up.  I have you court- martialed", you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typical fucking ARVN, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gook went too far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chef, take the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chef takes the wheel of the boat as the Chief moves back  and starts brushing his teeth.  Lance continues to unwrap his skis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sticking pinholes and mutilating  the centerfold and shit like that.   And the sergeant said, "You better  not do that to her.  You leave  your shitty little gook hands off  of that girl!"  Gook say, "Fuck  you!"  In Vietnamese, right?   Sergeant, man, he just couldn't  handle it no more.  He just picked  up his iron-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up an M16 rifle to demonstrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -flipped it to rock 'n' roll and  boom!  Gave that little zero a  long burst straight through the  Playboy mag.  It blew his ass clear  out off the dock.  There wasn't no  more lieutenant that day.  That  was it for his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They burn him for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sergeant?  Yeah, man.  They  stuck his ass in the L.B.J. It's  too bad he didn't get no medals or  nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the rifle back in the rack.  Disappears down the  hole of the ship.  They all shake their heads at the crue injustice of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking ARVN, man.  They should've  killed the fuck.  Should've given  that fucker a Silver Star.  Bummer  for the gook, though, ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR a radio station playing.  Willard is seated looki through the dossier, documents from the C.I.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Vietnam.  I'm Army  Specialist Zack Johnson on A.M.N.V.  It's about eighty-two degrees in  downtown Saigon right now, also  very humid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean is standing on the front of the boat, he has a smal transistor radio in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and we have an important message  for all G.I.s who are living offbase  from the mayor of Saigon.  He's  like you to hand the laundry up  indoors, instead of the windowsills.   The major wants you to keep Saigon  beautiful.  And now, here's another  blast from the past going out to  Big Sam, who's all alone out there  with the First Battalion, 35th  Infantry, and dedicated by the  Fire Team and their groovy C.O.  The Rolling Stones, "Satisfaction."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music comes on, Clean starts dancing, keeping time to "Satisfaction." The others cheer him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work out, Clean!  Get down, bubba! (to Lance) Hang on, Lance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE that Lance is water-skiing behind the PBR, waving  to the guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dancing) Can you dig it, man?  Can you dig  it? (to Chef) I see you're right on target. (to group) Work out!  Yeah!  Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat passes a Vietnamese fishing boat, capsizing it i its wake.

dialogues.speaker: VIEW ON WILLARD
dialogues.text: He's found himself in a corner in the boat.  He looks to  the front where Clean is moving and dancing to the MUSIC, to the rear where Lance is water-skiing, and looks down t his dossier, with its odd assortment of photographs,  reports, and letters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Commitment and Counterinsurgency"  by Walter E. Kurtz.  "As long as  our officers and troops perform  tours of duty limited to one year,  they will remain dilettantes in  war, and tourists in Vietnam.  As  long as cold beer, hot food, rock  'n' roll, and all the other  amenities remain expected norm,  our conduct of the war will only  gain impotence.  We need fewer  men, and better.  If they were  committed, this war could be won  with a fourth of our present force."

dialogues.speaker: THE PBR CREW
dialogues.text: The Chief is at the helm.  He takes off his sunglasses an looks straight ahead, reacting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two PBR's coming straight at them.  The lead PBR is heade on a collision course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.  Chicken time.  You ain't  shittin', bro. They're  motherfuckers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that?  What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All are looking forward.  The Chief grabs the loud-hailer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over loud-hailer) Is that you, Lazzaro?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chief) Don't chicken out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lead PBR keeps coming on in a game of "chicken," the  rock music blaring from its speakers.  Then it swerves at the last possible moment and fishtails past.  One of its  CREWMEN moons our crew.  Lance, Chef, and Clean shout bac and give them the finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicken!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other PBR fishtails past also, causing a lot of  turbulence in the water.  The crew gives our boys the  finger, then one of them throws a SMOKE BOMB.  It lands o the canopy. The smoke bomb spews out its YELLOW SMOKE, and suddenly  the canopy catches on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire on the canopy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chef grabs a fire extinguisher and tries to snuff the fir out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it!  Get out of there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief keeps roaring down the river as the others continue to fight the fire.  Finally they get it out . Willard sta there, dumbfounded, and reacting, as we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PBR continues down the river.  Lance gives a handful  of palm leaves to Chef, who is sitting up on top of the  canvas roof, trying to patch up the hole that was caused  by the fire.  Clean has a pair of drumsticks and is beati out a drum rhythm, really getting into it. Willard studies the dossier; some photos and Vietnamese  I.D. cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late summer, autumn 1968.  Kurtz's  patrol into the highlands is coming  under frequent bush.  The camp  started falling apart.  November.   Kurtz orders assassinations of  three Vietnamese men and one woman.   Two of the men were colonels in  the South Vietnamese Army.  Enemy  activity in his old sector dropped  off to nothing.  Guess he must  have hit the right four people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Willard) He joined the Special Forces, and  after that he...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The army tried one last time to  bring him back into the fold.  And  if he'd pulled over, it would have  been forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...unsound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he kept going.  And he kept  winning it his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Willard) ...with this Montagnard army of  his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they called me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Willard) ...like a god, and follow every  order, however ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lost him.  He was gone.   Nothing but rumors and random  intelligence, mostly from captured  V.C. The V.C. knew his name by  now, and they were scared of him.   He and his men were playing hit  and run all the way into Cambodia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean's drum rhythm is annoying Willard.  He puts a map  back into his dossier, rises, and looks at Clean, pissed, then looks to the Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean stops drumming, moves away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chief) How long has that kid been on this  boat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's really specializing in busting  my balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very possibly, Captain, he thinks  the same of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willard moves over to Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?  What do you think, Chief?

dialogues.speaker: CLEAN
dialogues.text: Clean gives Willard the finger behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think.  My orders say I'm  not supposed to know where I'm  taking this boat, so I don't.  But  one look at you and I know it's  gonna be hot, wherever it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willard comes into the cabin, looks at the Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going up river, about seventy- five clicks about the Do Lung  bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief reacts, figuring it out almost immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Cambodia, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's classified.  We're not  supposed to be in Cambodia, but  that's where I'm going.  You just  get me close to my destination,  and I'll cut you loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PBR moves down the river.  Willard is studying the  dossier, holding a LETTER from Kurtz to his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading letter) "Dear Son.  I'm afraid that both  you and your mother will have  worried at not hearing from me  during the past weeks, but my  situation here has become a  difficult one.  I have been  officially accused of murder by  the army.  The alleged victims  were four Vietnamese double agents.   We spent months uncovering then  and accumulating evidence.  When  absolute proof was completed, we  acted.  We acted like soldiers.   The charges are unjustified.  They  are, in fact, and under the  circumstances of this conflict,  quite completely insane."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat moves past some DEAD AMERICAN PILOTS.  Their bod are lying in the water, on the bank, and in the trees, al torn apart and bloody.  There is smoke and debris all  around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing reading  letter) "In a war, there are many moments  for compassion and tender action.   There are many moments for ruthless  action.  What is often called  ruthless, but may, in many  circumstances, be only clarity.   Seeing clearly what there is to be  done, and doing it directly,  quickly, awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come upon a burning helicopter, which has crashed in one of the trees on the shore.  This explains the dead  American bodies.  The Chief picks up the radio phone,  calling to headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Request-dust off.  Three, maybe  four KIAs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing reading  letter) "I will trust you tell your mother  what you choose about this letter.   As for the charges against me, I  am unconcerned.  I am beyond their  timid, lying morality, and so I am  beyond caring.  You have all my  faith.  Your loving father.

dialogues.speaker: A SHADOWY PHOTO OF KURTZ
dialogues.text: The caption "Photo believed to be Col. W. E. Kurtz."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a tremendous, tropical rainfall.  The PBR pulls in  toward an American outpost that is being used as a forwar medical evacuation center.  Various helicopter pads are  seen but only one helicopter-the one painted with the  Playboy bunny logo that brought the girls to Hau Phat.   The whole area is a mess with mud and debris and looks  deserted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacting) Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder I couldn't get them on  the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a dump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several soldiers in raincoats come out from a tent as the PBR pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a nice little boat you got  there.  Never seen one up here  before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We called in a request for a  medevac.  You guys didn't receive  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medevac?  No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We passed a downed Huey with some  KIAs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your way here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) You going up this river?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way up river?  Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wanna send some people down  river.  Just forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn around and start to go back to their tents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Willard) What the fuck was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) We'll be back in a couple of days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier looks at him as though he must be crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right, you'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They return to the tent.  Willard steps off the PBR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what you can do with that  engine.  I'm gonna have a look  around.  And don't leave without  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks up the muddy bank and through the deserted camp. Half of it is blown down.  The whole installation has the look of a ghost town.  TWO SOLDIERS approach, huddled in  their ponchos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, solder, where's your C.O.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask me, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willard wanders around the desolate place.  Other soldier pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys, where's your C.O.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stepped on a land mine about  two months ago.  Got all blown to  hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's in charge here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charge?  I don't know man.  I'm  just the night man.  Just doing  what I'm told.  I'm just a working  girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just giggles and turns off walking into the mud and  rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to other soldier) What about you, fella?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other soldier turns around smiling idiotically, and  making animal noises.  He stumbles off after his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance, Chef, and Clean are sitting on the dock surrounded by enormous pile of clothes, boots, all sorts of brand ne junk, seemingly abandoned.  Chief remains with the boat. Clean is working on Lance's M16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance, man, I'm telling you it's  gonna jam.  You mark my words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off my back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance, in an unexplainable fit of temper, turns to Clean, jumping on him and pulling him into the mud.  Chef, seein a brawl, jumps into it as well.  All wrestle in the mud.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO WILLARD
dialogues.text: He hears a voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you!  Come here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willard turns to see the Hollywood agent from the Hau Pha show under the flap of a large tent, hiding from the rain waving Willard to come over. His clothes are the same he wore at the Hau Phat show but wet and dirty.  He motions Willard over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here.  Is that your boat?   Come on inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
